powerwalk.control

Class Mapper

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Thread
      • powerwalk.control.Mapper
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public class Mapper
extends java.lang.Thread
    This class collects data from the RSBot environment and stores it in the singleton WorldMap-object

    • Field Detail

      • MAP_CONTINOUSLY

        public static final int MAP_CONTINOUSLY
        Policy for the Mapper, indicating that the world map should be updated continously.
        See Also:

      • MAP_ONCE

        public static final int MAP_ONCE
        Policy for the Mapper, indicating that the world map should be updated once, and then stop.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • MAP_NONE

        public static final int MAP_NONE
        Policy for the Mapper, indicating that the Mapper should not update the map. Warning: Setting this policy manually may cause an IllegalThreadStateException to be thrown when trying to start mapping again.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Method Detail

      • setPolicy

        public static void setPolicy(int policy)
        Changes the mapping policy to the given policy. When the given policy is not valid, this method does nothing.

        Parameters:
        policy - the new mapping policy

      • startMapping

        public static void startMapping(int policy)
        Starts the Mapper with the given policy. When the given policy is not valid, the MAP_ONCE policy will be used.

        Parameters:
        policy - the policy to use for the Mapper (MAP_CONTINOUSLY or MAP_ONCE)

        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalThreadStateException - when the Mapper is already / still running

      • setEcoMode

        public static void setEcoMode(boolean mode)
        Turns the Eco-mode of the Mapper on or off. When the Mapper runs in Eco-mode, the Mapper tries to prevent mapping already mapped areas, preventing unnecessary World Map writes. Instead, the Mapper tries to reduce CPU-load by checking for map data less frequently, but still frequent enough to not miss any data.

        Parameters:
        mode -

      • ecoMode

        public static boolean ecoMode()

      • stopMapping

        public static void stopMapping()
        Stops the currently running Mapper.

        If there is no running Mapper, this method does nothing. Otherwise, it sets the mapping policy to MAP_NONE and lets the Mapper end gracefully.

        Please note that the Mapper might not be stopped directly when this method returns. However, after this method returns, it is possible to start a new Mapper.

      • isMapping

        public static boolean isMapping()
        Returns whether or not the Mapper is mapping.

        When the mapping policy has been set to MAP_NONE, but the Mapper hasn't completed gracefully yet, this method returns false.

        Returns:
        true if and only if the Mapper is currently mapping, returns false otherwise.

      • run

        public void run()
        run-method for the Mapper.

        It should not be called directly. Instead, the startMapping(int) and stopMapping() methods should be used.

        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable
        Overrides:
        run in class java.lang.Thread

      • convertToSides

        public int convertToSides(int flag)
